name: intercrystalline
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
between or among crystals (= solids consisting of atoms or molecules arranged in a regular structure): Organic material that is dispersed between grains is called the intercrystalline organic matter. Inter-crystalline or interparticle voids are present in all rocks.
More examplesFewer examplesIn metals, the microstructure is formed by grains and inter-crystalline matter.The replacement reaction can proceed rapidly at all inter-crystalline boundaries. This can lead to inter-crystalline porosity.These crystals have a mostly continuous intercrystalline organic matrix.
